nodes.title: Note After Detailer
widgets_values:
Make sure to download your models from the "Install Models" section of the Manager. Once downloaded (and ComfyUI restarted), select your specific models manually for these nodes.

Seed controlled locally for repeat generation of faces without regenerating all images prior.

nodes.title: Preview Text to Image or Control Net
Note CTRLNET
widgets_values:
Control Net:

TTxt2IMG/CTRLN - Turn off the Control Net in the Control Net Stack for basic Text to Image generation.

nodes.title: Prompt Builder POS
widgets_values: On the extraterrestrial expanse of Celestria, luminescent flora swayed in harmony with the ambient melodies of the wind, while floating islands dotted the skies like celestial stepping stones, (8K, Realistic, Hyperrealism, Depth of Field, 85mm lens, F/4.6:1.15), (ultra detailed, ultra accurate detailed:1.1), (Bokeh, Bokeh Lighting:1.1), (surrealism:1.05)

nodes.title: Negative (FaceDetailer)
widgets_values: low quality, worst quality, bad anatomy, scars, tattoos

nodes.title: Positive (FaceDetailer)
widgets_values: (Detailed Face:1.2), (ultra detailed:1.2), (photorealistic:1.2), (Hypperrealism:1.1), (natural skin pores:1.1), (natural blemishes:1.05), (natural wrinkles:1.1), (makeup:1.1)

-------- INSTRUCTION GUIDE ---------

1. PIPE Switches and ON OFF Switches
    POS Prompt Switch - Switches the Positive prompt between not using the Cutoff(option 1) and using the Cutoff(option 2). Cutoff can be useful when trying to specify colors to items within the prompt.

    Txt2IMG/CTRLN - Turn off the Control Net in the Control Net Stack for basic Text to Image generation.

    TXT2IMG/USDU - Switches between using the Text to Image generated image or the Ultimate SD Upscale generated image during the After Detailer step of the workflow.

ON / OFF Switches:
   For the After Detailer there is an ON / OFF switch labeled with the section name. Switching this module to OFF means it will not run, and to ON means it will run.

2. Prompt Positive/Negative
   Prompt Builder (Inspire) is used heavily in the creation of the prompt. Use the category to select a category and select a preset to insert the text into the prompt. Edit these prompt-builder.yaml file in custom_nodes\ComfyUI-Inspire-Pack\resources directory to update your drop down selections.

   Cutoff is also used to try to tailor the image appropriately. View the https://github.com/BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_Cutoff repository to learn more about how this works.

Cliff notes:

Ctrl+ Up Arrow/Down Arrow - change the weight of the prompt.

[object:X] - adds object after a X steps
[object::X] - removes object after a X steps
[object1:object2:0.X] - first X% is object1, then swaps to object2
[object1:object2:X] - starts with object1, then changes to object2 at step X
[object1|object2] - alternates between object1 and object2 every step
[object1|object2|...|objectN] - alternates between object1 .. objectN, then loops back to object1

3. Save Image With Meta Data
    Use the controls in the Final Image Meta Date section to save which image you would like with the appropriate meta data for upload.

4. After Detailer
    This allows you to alter specific portions of an image detected by the Ultralytics models. This includes face detection, hand detection, and person detection. This is basically just inpainting, with the masks drawn for you.

4.1 Face Detailer
    Select one of the bbox/face_*.pt models. Personally, I like using the bbox/face_yolov8n_v2.pt model for this.

*Must Be added to workflow*
4.2 Hand Detailer
    Select one of the bbox/hand_*.pt models. I'd suggest the bbox/hand_yolov8n.pt model.

4.3 Person Detailer
    Select one of the segm/person_*.pt models. I haven't played with this much, so you will need to experiment with which model works best for you.

5. Copy / Paste
    With ComfyUI, there is the concept of the Clipspace, which is essentially like a clipboard, keeping track of all your copies and allowing you to paste them. If you just generated an image that you want to Inpaint, right click on the image and select "Copy (Clipspace)". You can then right click on the Inpaint Image node and select "Paste (Clipspace)".

6. LCM
    LCM Model Sampling is used within this workflow. It is recommended to use between 5-10 Steps and 1-2 CFG for quick accurate image generation. You must download the Lora at the link below. You must also set the sampler_name in your KSamplers to LCM (sgm_uniform scheduler recommended).

https://huggingface.co/latent-consistency/lcm-lora-sdxl/tree/main

7. Nodes/Models
    To install missing nodes/models use the ComfyUI Manager and select Install Missing Custom Nodes. Then install the models you need via Install Models within the ComfyUI Manager.
https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager

NOTE: For SDXL based models, it is recommended to use trained resolution values listed below:
 - 1024 x 1024
 - 1152 x 896
 - 896  x 1152
 - 1216 x 832
 - 832  x 1216
 - 1344 x 768
 - 768  x 1344
 - 1536 x 640
 - 640  x 1536


Any recommendations/issues can be left on the comment section of the workflow.
Or join the ComfyUI Workflows Discord and @PCMonster so we can chat.
Enjoy!

widgets_values:
Pipe 1 = Txt2Img

Pipe 2 = Ultimate SD Upscale

widgets_values:
Condition1 = Basic Prompt
